1 // $Id: NumberOperators.js 136 2008-03-13 10:55:02Z dandfra $
  2 
  3 Ext.namespace('Ext.ux.netbox.number');
  4 
  5 /** It instantiates a new NumberRangeOperator
  6   * @class This is the class that implements the range operator between 2 numbers. The id of the operator is NUMBER_RANGE
  7   * @constructor
  8   * @extends Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator
  9   */
 10 Ext.ux.netbox.number.NumberRangeOperator = function() {
 11   Ext.ux.netbox.number.NumberRangeOperator.superclass.constructor.call(this,"NUMBER_RANGE",this.includeText);
 12   var validateFn=function(value){
 13     var isOk=this.getField().emptyNotAllowedFn(value);
 14     if(isOk!==true){
 15       return(isOk);
 16     }
 17     if(value.length!=2){
 18       return(this.bothFromAndToNotEmpty);
 19     }
 20     var fromANumber=this.isNumeric(value[0].value);
 21     var toANumber=this.isNumeric(value[1].value);
 22     if(!fromANumber && !toANumber){
 23       return(this.toAndFromNotANumber);
 24     }
 25     
 26     if(!fromANumber){
 27       return(this.fromNotANumber);
 28     }
 29     
 30     if(!toANumber){
 31       return(this.toNotANumber);
 32     }
 33     
 34     if(parseFloat(value[0].value)>parseFloat(value[1].value)){
 35       return(this.fromBiggerThanTo);
 36     }
 37     return(true);
 38   }
 39   this.setValidateFn(validateFn);
 40 }
 41 
 42 Ext.extend(Ext.ux.netbox.number.NumberRangeOperator,Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator,/** @scope Ext.ux.netbox.number.NumberRangeOperator.prototype */{
 43 
 44   fromText    : 'from',
 45   toText      : 'to',
 46   includeText : 'between',
 47   bothFromAndToNotEmpty: "Both 'from' and 'to' must have a value",
 48   fromBiggerThanTo: "From is bigger than to",
 49   fromNotANumber: "From is not a number",
 50   toNotANumber: "To is not a number",
 51   toAndFromNotANumber: "From and to are not numbers",
 52   isNumeric: function (value){
 53     if(Ext.type(value)==='number'){
 54       return(isFinite(value));
 55     } else if(Ext.type(value)==='string'){
 56       // I use this function like this: if (isNumeric(myVar)) { }
 57       // regular expression that validates a value is numeric
 58       if(value.lastIndexOf(".")===value.length){
 59         return("A number should not end with a .");
 60       }
 61       var RegExp = /^(-)?(\d+)(\.?)(\d*)$/;
 62       // Note: this WILL allow a number that ends in a decimal: -452.
 63       // compare the argument to the RegEx
 64       // the 'match' function returns 0 if the value didn't match
 65   
 66       return(value.match(RegExp));
 67     }
 68     return(false);
 69   },
 70 
 71   /** This method creates an aditor used to edit the range of numbers
 72     * @param {String} operatorId The operatorId actually used in the filter
 73     * @return {Ext.Editor} The field used to edit the values of this filter
 74     */
 75   createEditor: function(operatorId){
 76     var field=new Ext.ux.netbox.core.RangeField({
 77       textCls: Ext.form.NumberField,
 78       fromConfig: {},
 79       toConfig: {}
 80     });
 81     var editor=new Ext.ux.netbox.FilterEditor(field);
 82     field.on("editingcompleted",editor.completeEdit,editor);
 83     return editor;
 84   },
 85 /** This function returns a string rendering the values. The format is da: (value[0].label), a: (value[1].label).
 86     * If the value doesn't have any of the elements, "" is used.
 87     * @param {Array} The value to render
 88     * @return {String} The rendered value
 89     * @private
 90     */
 91   render: function(value){
 92     var valueFrom=value[0] == undefined ? '' : value[0].label;
 93     var valueTo=value[1] == undefined ? '' : value[1].label;
 94     return(this.fromText+": "+valueFrom+", "+this.toText+": "+valueTo);
 95   }
 96 });
